item.title: HGVs exceeding weight limit, 11th August
item.description:
Since the closure of Evesham Road in Bishop’s Cleeve, traffic through Stoke Orchard has significantly increased, including HGVs exceeding the 7.5-tonne weight limit that shouldn’t be using the village routes. This has led to greater noise pollution and disruption for local residents, affecting the quality of life in the area.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stoke Road, Stoke Orchard, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Noise Pollution, 11th August
item.description:
The road surface from the Stoke Orchard M5 bridge to past Copse Green Lane is extremely coarse since it was re-laid a few years ago, causing significant noise pollution from passing vehicles for local residents. The issue has been worsened by increased traffic volume, including a rise in HGVs over 7.5 tonnes travelling through Stoke Orchard. Please consider resurfacing the road with a more acoustically sympathetic material when it’s next due for maintenance.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cursey Lane, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues
